intro: Cephaelis spectabilis, commonly known as the showy cephaelis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and thrives in temperate climates. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking unique and colorful foliage.
